alert.note: Alert for Polk (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 12:39PM EST until December 27 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Henderson and Polk. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM EST, Through the afternoon, there will be the ongoing threat of additional scattered heavy showers to aggravate lingering high water conditions across the region. Please remain wary of high flows and possible flooding of low-lying areas from this morning`s heavy rainfall throughout the Green and North Pacolet River basins. - Some locations that may experience lingering flooding include... Columbus, Flat Rock, Tryon, Saluda, Lake Adger, Mill Spring, Green Creek, East Flat Rock and Tuxedo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
